Articles.Content:
Hello people!

Yeah, I am building my first computer! I don't know yet a name, I think about "communicate"(my grandmother died due to dementia 4 days ago, and she couldn't communicate.), but I don't know yet.

I have just installed my hard disk drive, cd-rom drive, and the power supply. Tommorow I will install the rest.

specs:

processor: IntelÃ‚Â® CoreÃ¢â€žÂ¢ i5-3570K 3400 mhz, Level2 Cache: 4x 256 KB, Level3 Cache: 6144 KB

video card: ASUS GT640-2GD32GB ram, 128 bit

case: MS-TECH CA-0270GR Xerxes

motherboard: ASRock Fatal1ty Z77 Performance

harddrive: Seagate ST2000DM001 2 TB ms/Cache/rpm: 8,5/64/7200

memory: Corsair 16 GB DDR3-1866 Quad-Kit 4x4

power supply: Antec EA-450 Platinum

and some other stuff!

It runs windows 7, althought windows 8 is cheaper, but that's my problem!

pictures so far:

Special thanks to Leonov because he helped me with choosing the basics, but I didn't used any parts of it, because it all was dutch. I used his "style" I think.

Sorry for my bad english by the way.

EDIT: Tada! I am posting this from my new pc! I am proud

You see that little piece of duct-tape? One cable for the fans didn't fit, but they are both the same type(I think molex), so I made a solution on a other way.

Edited May 24, 2013 by joppiesaus
Lookin good. Good choices, Hope it lasts for years to come.
This isnt the place to discuss hardware, Go to the KSP Unofficial Official Computer Building Megathread. We have plenty of pages about SSDs.

You forgot the SSD!

I didn't invest in an SSD, because it is very expensive. 88 Ã¢â€šÂ¬ for 2TB 7200RPM is quick 'nough. I donÃ‚Â´t need a pc that strts in 8 seconds.

It runs windows 7, althought windows 8 is cheaper, but that's my problem!

seems to me thats more of a solution to a problem than a problem.

Good system though, I don't think you'll be thinking about upgrading for quite some time with that.
